definition: to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
small/tiny/few/young
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
to send/to commission/messenger/mission

sentences.english: Her head certainly was in the clouds--she looked like her mind was a thousand miles away.
sentences.chinese: 她一定在開小差，看起來她的心思早就在千里之外了。

sentences.english: Only in this way can focus on, without thinking of deserting.
sentences.chinese: 這樣才能使精力集中，而不至於思想開小差。

sentences.english: Soldiers swept the town, looking for deserters.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊把小鎮搜查得十分徹底，想搜出開小差的士兵。

sentences.english: The number of AWOL soldiers has doubled since we invaded Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 自從我們入侵伊拉克以來，開小差的人數增長了一倍。

sentences.english: As he hated army life, he decided to desert his regiment.
sentences.chinese: 由於他厭惡軍隊生活，他決計開小差。

sentences.english: We train students to do that exact thing by talking too much.
sentences.chinese: 我們老師說的太多，就等同於訓練學生開小差。

sentences.english: My thoughts were beginning to digress.
sentences.chinese: 我的思想開始開小差了。

sentences.english: eg: 1. Many soldiers deserted during the battle.
sentences.chinese: 在那次戰鬥中許多士兵開小差了。
他開小差逃離他所在的團。

sentences.english: My attention was wandering when the teacher read the textbook.
sentences.chinese: 老師讀課本時滓開小差了。

sentences.english: Whenever you drift, come back to being aware of sitting and breathing.
sentences.chinese: 任何時候你開小差了，就重新注意自己的坐姿和呼吸。

sentences.english: I didn't expect to see you at this hour. You must have goofed off again.
sentences.chinese: 這個點我不應該看到你的，你準開小差了。

sentences.english: Kingcraft is born to be in thought absquatulate be called by the teacher confused.
sentences.chinese: 王道生正在思想開小差被教師一喊慌了。

sentences.english: His desertion from the army brought dishonour on his family.
sentences.chinese: 他當兵開小差使得全家人蒙羞。

sentences.english: I'm afraid I didn't . officer. I must have been dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 警官，恐怕我剛纔沒看見，我一定是思想開小差了。

definition: to get straight to the point (idiom)
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
reckless/extremely daring
foolish talk/nonsense
ability/skill
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to mime/a dumb show
annoying/disgusting
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
any Tom, Dick or Harry/anyone (contemptuous)
